<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Sometimes, email spam filters leave our newsletter out in the cold (A+ transition). To make sure the Brew is hitting your inbox every day, please make sure you…</p>

<div class="c6 " style="margin-bottom:7px">
<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
IMMIGRATION
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/business-leaders-push-daca?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
DACA's Day in D.C.
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Supreme Court building in Washington, D.C. " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTkzNzMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>MANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The U.S. Supreme Court heard <a href="https://apnews.com/338e568dba644de597185309a790e09d?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">arguments</a> yesterday over the future of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, or DACA.   </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The backstory: </strong>Former President Obama introduced the program in 2012 to protect undocumented immigrants brought to the U.S. as children from deportation. DACA doesn't offer a path to citizenship, but it does allow the young immigrants, commonly known as "Dreamers," to legally work in the U.S.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Nearly 700,000 people are currently protected by DACA.</span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">In 2017, the Trump administration announced it was ending the program, but that decision has been held up in the court system. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>President Trump </span><span><a href="https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1194219655717642240?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">tweeted yesterday</a></span><span> that in the event of a Supreme Court overturn, he'd work with Democrats to allow Dreamers to stay. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>In the tweet he also said that some Dreamers are "very tough, hardened criminals." However, anyone with a felony conviction (or a serious misdemeanor in some cases) gets booted from the program. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Now let's introduce some people you probably weren't expecting</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Apple CEO Tim Cook, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Microsoft President Brad Smith. Following the Trump administration's move to end DACA in 2017, they and many other tech execs <a href="https://www.vox.com/2017/9/5/16255490/microsoft-satya-nadella-offered-aid-employee-worker-trump-daca-dreamer-deport?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">mobilized</a> to support the protections. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>As an industry, Big Tech is particularly vocal about immigration policy. Many execs are immigrants themselves, and they argue that innovation relies on the flow of talent across borders. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Roughly 75% of the top 25 Fortune 500 companies </span><span><a href="https://blogs.microsoft.com/on-the-issues/2019/11/08/standing-up-for-every-dreamer/?utm_source=newsletter&utm_medium=email&utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin&stream=top&utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">employ Dreamers</a></span><span>, according to Microsoft's Smith. </span>
</li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Microsoft is actually <a href="https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-technology-202/2019/11/11/the-technology-202-microsoft-takes-its-fight-for-dreamers-in-its-ranks-to-the-supreme-court/5dc839c588e0fa10ffd20d21/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">one of the plaintiffs</a> in the case brought before the Supreme Court. The company employs more than five dozen DACA recipients. Apple says it <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/02/tech/daca-tim-cook-apple/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">employs 443</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Looking ahead...</strong>reports <a href="https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/supreme-court-appears-inclined-let-trump-end-daca-program-n1080796?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">hinted</a> that the conservative majority is leaning toward allowing the Trump administration to wind down DACA, but we probably won't have a ruling until the spring of 2020. Then, things should be calmer politically.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
FOOD AND BEV
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/dean-foods-files-bankruptcy?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
What’ll We Dip Our Cookies Into?
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="draining cow" style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTkzMjQwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Francis Scialabba</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Dean Foods, the U.S.’ largest milk producer, <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/12/business/dean-foods-bankruptcy/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">filed for bankruptcy</a> yesterday in order to secure financing and reorient itself for a brave new world of dairy. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">That new world involves less lactose. The market for milk alternatives is expected to surpass $18 billion this year, per Euromonitor data cited by CNN. Tack on falling prices and retailers like Walmart <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/12/dean-foods-americas-biggest-milk-producer-files-for-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">shifting</a> to private label brands...and Dean is caught between a rock and a wall of oat milk cartons. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>Dean's sales were down 7% in the first six months of the year, and profit sank 14%. Shares </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-12/dean-foods-files-for-chapter-11-bankruptcy-reorganization-k2vtfqk6?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">have lost</a></span><span> over 80% of their value in 2019. </span>
</li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The company is laden with debt and can’t cover workers’ pensions.  </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">The way out: </strong>Dean’s in talks with the Dairy Farmers of America (DFA) about a deal in which DFA would buy almost all of Dean, a dairy aisle mainstay that produces Land O'Lakes and Organic Valley's milks. Dean also said it’s secured $850 million in financing from existing lenders. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Bottom line: </strong>Per capita liquid milk consumption in the U.S. has <a href="https://apnews.com/5eb1173f5e2b4994927bc921f5b49f0e?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">declined</a> more than 40% since 1975.</p>

<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
PAYMENTS
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/facebook-introduces-facebook-pay?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Move Fast and Pay Things
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="Facebook pay " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiJ1cGxvYWRzL21lZGl1bS9hc3NldC83MjAzL2ZhY2Vib29rX3BheS5qcGciLCJidWNrZXQiOiJvc2xvLXByb2R1Y3Rpb24iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Facebook</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Mark Zuckerberg’s all about creating connections. Up next: your wallet + Facebook’s platforms. Yesterday, his company <a href="https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/11/simplifying-payments-with-facebook-pay/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> the launch of “Facebook Pay” on its flagship product and Messenger, with plans to add it to Instagram and WhatsApp later. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The service <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/12/20961447/facebook-pay-whatsapp-instagram-messenger-features?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">supports</a> major payment systems so users can send no-fee transactions. Think birthday fundraisers, in-game purchases, shopping, and paying your roomie for whatever <img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/flag-for-bangladesh_1f1e7-1f1e9.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/classical-building_1f3db.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/man-with-ball_26f9-fe0f-200d-2642-fe0f.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""><img src="https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/google/223/octopus_1f419.png" class="img-responsive" width="18" style="width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;" alt=""> is.</p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>PayPal, which pulled out of Facebook’s Libra cryptocurrency project, is a partner. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Facebook’s assured us that payment data is encrypted, private, and monitored for fraud. Users can add a PIN or biometric controls (like face unlock) for extra security. </span></li>
</ul>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">What about that crypto project?</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">If Libra is the Thanksgiving turkey you tried deep frying but <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/10/14/visa-mastercard-stripe-ebay-leave-libra?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">caught on fire</a>, Facebook Pay is the backup rotisserie chicken. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Libra co-creator David Marcus recently acknowledged that Facebook’s positioning of Libra as a “new currency” (rather than “payments platform”) probably contributed to the sour reception. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Zoom out: </strong>With 31% of the global population using its platforms, Facebook thinks it can disrupt payments with one of these approaches.</p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
AUTO
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/elon-musk-announced-site-gigafactory-4?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Guess the Skyline
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<img alt="skyline of a european city " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" class="story-header-image" src="https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTk0NDg5LmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Unsplash</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Thought you could doze off in the middle of the newsletter? Never. Time for a pop quiz.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">While speaking at an awards show yesterday, Tesla CEO Elon Musk <a href="https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/12/20961812/elon-musk-berlin-tesla-ceo-fourth-gigafactory-construction?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">announced</a> that the location of Tesla's fourth "Gigafactory" will be outside the European city shown above. What city is it? (Answer at the bottom of the newsletter.) </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The locations of the <a href="https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/12/tesla-ceo-elon-musk-announces-gigafactory-design-center-near-berlin.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">three other Gigafactories</a>:</p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A battery plant near Reno, NV</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A charging and power equipment plant in Buffalo, NY</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px">
<span>A car plant that was built in </span><span><a href="https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-10-23/elon-musk-opened-tesla-s-shanghai-gigafactory-in-just-168-days?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">a record</a></span><span> 168 working days in Shanghai, China</span>
</li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000"></strong></p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"> </p>

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-top: 12px;">
<a href="https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F12%2Felon-musk-announced-site-gigafactory-4" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e865734bf6f7.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://twitter.com/intent/tweet?text=Where+will+Gigafactory+4+be+built%3F+&url=https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/elon-musk-announced-site-gigafactory-4&via=MorningBrew" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">
<img alt="" style="display: inline-block; width: 25px" width="25" src="https://media.sailthru.com/5z8/1k4/4/2/5e86574d1eb82.jpg">
</a><span>  </span>
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/shareArticle?mini=true&url=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F12%2Felon-musk-announced-site-gigafactory-4&title=Elon+Musk+Announced+the+Site+of+Gigafactory+4&source=www.morningbrew.com&summary=Where+will+Gigafactory+4+be+built%3F+" target="_blank" rel="noopener" style="text-decoration: none;" class="">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
SOCIAL MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/instagram-testing-reels-tiktoklike-new-feature?email={{profile.email}}" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
Instagram Users Are Reeling
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Another story about a Facebook app? Complaints can be directed to the antitrust division at the DOJ. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Taking on TikTok</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Yesterday, Instagram started <a href="https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/instagram-reels-brazil-1203401673/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">testing</a> a new feature in Brazil called “Reels” that spices up videos with music and fancy editing tools. Sound familiar?</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Yes, but there's a big difference</strong>. TikTok's a standalone app, whereas Instagram is integrating Reels into its existing app. Users can share Reels through stories or messages. They can also see some trending videos in the "Explore" section. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Working in Insta's favor are 1) a prebaked audience of 1+ billion monthly users and 2) the U.S. <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/11/04/us-launches-national-security-probe-bytedance?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">investigating</a> TikTok's parent company for national security reasons. </p>
<h2 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0">Tossing out likes</h2>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">When even Kim Kardashian West <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/06/top-takeaways-dealbook-conference?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pipes in</a> to say likes are bad for mental health, platforms have to (at least pretend to) do something. After months of tests abroad, Instagram's removing likes for some U.S. users. They can still like posts, but metrics won't be public-facing. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Not everyone's on board. </strong>Some critics have <a href="https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/11/tech/instagram-likes-going-away/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">pointed</a> out that comments, bullying, and overly staged content are Instagram's real problems.</p>

<!-- <![endif]-->
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<th class="card" style="text-align:left;font-weight:400;font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#333;display:block;background-color:#fff;border-radius:15px;border:1px solid #e6e6e6;border-collapse:collapse;box-shadow:none;margin-bottom:0px">
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">
MEDIA
</h3>
<h1 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px">
<a href="#" target="_blank" style="color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;">
<font color="#000000">
The 4-Minute History of Disney
</font></a>
</h1>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
<!--[if mso]>
<img alt="Disney's old title sequence animation " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" height=503 src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YrTRjKUOxidDP78nfY/giphy.gif">
<![endif]-->
<!--[if !mso]>--><!-- -->
<img class="story-header-image" alt="Disney's old title sequence animation " style="display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;" width="670" src="https://media.giphy.com/media/YrTRjKUOxidDP78nfY/giphy.gif">
<!--<![endif]-->
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;">
<small><em>Giphy</em></small>
</p>
<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding:15px">
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Nearly 100 years ago, The Walt Disney Company was a startup founded by two brothers who thought Mortimer Mouse was a good name for a character. Today, it’s a $250 billion entertainment colossus.</p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">But in many ways, yesterday’s <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">launch of Disney+</a> marks the start of Disney’s next century. </p>
<ul style="margin-top:0;padding-left:30px">
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Over the last two decades, it’s built a huge ecosystem of original content, including Disney classics plus world-class IP from Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and Nat Geo. </span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>With Disney+, the company’s going where the cord-cutting customers are. Disney created a technology platform for direct-to-consumer distribution, standing up an offering to compete with Netflix, Apple TV+, and Amazon Prime Video. </span></li>
</ul>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">The first Disney century wasn’t always easy. There were worker strikes, slumps in creativity, and a world war. Walt’s vision, and especially his successors’, often took trial and error. Just yesterday, the Disney+ rollout was <a href="https://www.reuters.com/article/us-walt-disney-streaming-outages/disney-launch-marred-by-glitches-as-demand-overwhelms-idUSKBN1XM1VP?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">plagued</a> by glitches. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">So how’d Disney get here? </strong><a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">Check out our four-minute history</a>. </p>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><sup class="sub-text"><em>This is the second part in our series on the streaming wars. If you missed the first part yesterday about the launch of Disney+, <a href="https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">check it out here</a>, and tune in tomorrow to learn about the business models of video content distribution. </em></sup></p>
</td>
</tr>
</table>
</th>
</tr>
</table>

</div>

<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px">Call us predictable during Disney+ launch week, but in today's edition of For the Gram we're asking you to find style/grammar errors in sentences related to <strong style="color:#000"><em>media</em></strong><em>. </em>As always, h/t to the <a href="https://blogs.wsj.com/styleandsubstance/?utm_source=morning_brew" target="_blank" class="link" rel="noopener" style="border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333">WSJ editors</a> for supplying the words. </p>
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Warner, for example, is recreating its comedies "Miss Congeniality" and "Blended" through a production venture in China.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>During the war, filmmakers churned out movies in close to real time, going from script to screen in as few as six months, said Mr. Harris.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>He came up with the name "Miramax," combining the names of their mother Miriam and father Max.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The Justice Department has raised the prospect that the telecom giant would have to divest either the Turner television unit, which includes CNN along with other cable channels, or the satellite DirecTV business, the people said.</span></li>
</ol>

<td style="padding: 15px;">
<h3 style="font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0">

<table width="100%" cellpadding="0" cellspacing="0" border="0" style="border-collapse: collapse;">
<tr>
<td style="padding-right:15px;padding-bottom:15px;padding-left:15px;padding-top:0px">
<ol>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>"Recreating" means to play. Warner is "re-creating" its comedies.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>The WSJ uses "few" for whole, countable items. Since a month isn't experienced as a singular chunk of time, the paper's editors recommend using "in as little as."</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>Since the subject only has one mother and father, there should be commas around the names: their mother, Miriam, and father, Max.</span></li>
<li style="line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px"><span>A company does not divest a unit, it divests itself of something. This should say "have to divest itself of."</span></li>
</ol>
<p style="line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px"><strong style="color:#000">Tesla Gigafactory answer: </strong>The European city is Berlin, Germany. </p>
</td>
</tr>

style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:16px;color:#1c7ff2;font-weight:700;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:0\"\u003e\nIMMIGRATION\n\u003c/h3\u003e\n\u003ch1 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:24px;color:#333;font-weight:700;margin-bottom:0;line-height:26px;margin-top:8px\"\u003e\n\u003ca style=\"color:#000000!important;text-decoration:none;border-bottom:none!important;\"\u003e\n\u003cfont color=\"#000000\"\u003e\nDACA's Day in D.C.\n\u003c/font\u003e\u003c/a\u003e\n\u003c/h1\u003e\n\u003c/td\u003e\n\u003c/tr\u003e\n\u003c/table\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"Supreme Court building in Washington, D.C. \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTkzNzMzLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eMANDEL NGAN/AFP via Getty Images\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe U.S. Supreme Court heard \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/338e568dba644de597185309a790e09d?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003earguments\u003c/a\u003e yesterday over the future of the Deferred Action for Childhood Arrivals program, or DACA.   \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe backstory: \u003c/strong\u003eFormer President Obama introduced the program in 2012 to protect undocumented immigrants brought to the U.S. as children from deportation. DACA doesn't offer a path to citizenship, but it does allow the young immigrants, commonly known as \"Dreamers,\" to legally work in the U.S.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eNearly 700,000 people are currently protected by DACA.\u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eIn 2017, the Trump administration announced it was ending the program, but that decision has been held up in the court system. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003ePresident Trump \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://twitter.com/realDonaldTrump/status/1194219655717642240?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etweeted yesterday\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e that in the event of a Supreme Court overturn, he'd work with Democrats to allow Dreamers to stay. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eIn the tweet he also said that some Dreamers are \"very tough, hardened criminals.\" However, anyone with a felony conviction (or a serious misdemeanor in some cases) gets booted from the program. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eNow let's introduce some people you probably weren't expecting\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eApple CEO Tim Cook, Facebook CEO Mark Zuckerberg, Google CEO Sundar Pichai, and Microsoft President Brad Smith. Following the Trump administration's move to end DACA in 2017, they and many other tech execs \u003ca href=\"https://www.vox.com/2017/9/5/16255490/microsoft-satya-nadella-offered-aid-employee-worker-trump-daca-dreamer-deport?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003emobilized\u003c/a\u003e to support the protections. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eAs an industry, Big Tech is particularly vocal about immigration policy. Many execs are immigrants themselves, and they argue that innovation relies on the flow of talent across borders. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eRoughly 75% of the top 25 Fortune 500 companies \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://blogs.microsoft.com/on-the-issues/2019/11/08/standing-up-for-every-dreamer/?utm_source=newsletter\u0026utm_medium=email\u0026utm_campaign=newsletter_axioslogin\u0026stream=top\u0026utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemploy Dreamers\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e, according to Microsoft's Smith. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eMicrosoft is actually \u003ca href=\"https://www.washingtonpost.com/news/powerpost/paloma/the-technology-202/2019/11/11/the-technology-202-microsoft-takes-its-fight-for-dreamers-in-its-ranks-to-the-supreme-court/5dc839c588e0fa10ffd20d21/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eone of the plaintiffs\u003c/a\u003e in the case brought before the Supreme Court. The company employs more than five dozen DACA recipients. Apple says it \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/10/02/tech/daca-tim-cook-apple/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eemploys 443\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eLooking ahead...\u003c/strong\u003ereports \u003ca href=\"https://www.nbcnews.com/politics/supreme-court/supreme-court-appears-inclined-let-trump-end-daca-program-n1080796?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehinted\u003c/a\u003e that the conservative majority is leaning toward allowing the Trump administration to wind down DACA, but we probably won't have a ruling until the spring of 2020. Then, things should be calmer politically.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F12%2Fbusiness-leaders-push-daca\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" class=\"story-header-image\" src=\"https://dlp31coh2a67q.cloudfront.net/eyJrZXkiOiIxNTczNTkzMjQwLmpwZyIsImJ1Y2tldCI6Im1vcm5pbmdicmV3LW9zbG8iLCJlZGl0cyI6eyJyZXNpemUiOnsid2lkdGgiOjEwMDAsImhlaWdodCI6bnVsbH19fQ==\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eFrancis Scialabba\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eDean Foods, the U.S.’ largest milk producer, \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/12/business/dean-foods-bankruptcy/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003efiled for bankruptcy\u003c/a\u003e yesterday in order to secure financing and reorient itself for a brave new world of dairy. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThat new world involves less lactose. The market for milk alternatives is expected to surpass $18 billion this year, per Euromonitor data cited by CNN. Tack on falling prices and retailers like Walmart \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnbc.com/2019/11/12/dean-foods-americas-biggest-milk-producer-files-for-bankruptcy.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eshifting\u003c/a\u003e to private label brands...and Dean is caught between a rock and a wall of oat milk cartons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\n\u003cspan\u003eDean's sales were down 7% in the first six months of the year, and profit sank 14%. Shares \u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.bloomberg.com/news/articles/2019-11-12/dean-foods-files-for-chapter-11-bankruptcy-reorganization-k2vtfqk6?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003ehave lost\u003c/a\u003e\u003c/span\u003e\u003cspan\u003e over 80% of their value in 2019. \u003c/span\u003e\n\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eThe company is laden with debt and can’t cover workers’ pensions.  \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eThe way out: \u003c/strong\u003eDean’s in talks with the Dairy Farmers of America (DFA) about a deal in which DFA would buy almost all of Dean, a dairy aisle mainstay that produces Land O'Lakes and Organic Valley's milks. Dean also said it’s secured $850 million in financing from existing lenders. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eBottom line: \u003c/strong\u003ePer capita liquid milk consumption in the U.S. has \u003ca href=\"https://apnews.com/5eb1173f5e2b4994927bc921f5b49f0e?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003edeclined\u003c/a\u003e more than 40% since 1975.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F12%2Fdean-foods-files-bankruptcy\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; Up next: your wallet + Facebook’s platforms. Yesterday, his company \u003ca href=\"https://newsroom.fb.com/news/2019/11/simplifying-payments-with-facebook-pay/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eannounced\u003c/a\u003e the launch of “Facebook Pay” on its flagship product and Messenger, with plans to add it to Instagram and WhatsApp later. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe service \u003ca href=\"https://www.theverge.com/2019/11/12/20961447/facebook-pay-whatsapp-instagram-messenger-features?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003esupports\u003c/a\u003e major payment systems so users can send no-fee transactions. Think birthday fundraisers, in-game purchases, shopping, and paying your roomie for whatever \u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/flag-for-bangladesh_1f1e7-1f1e9.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/classical-building_1f3db.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/apple/232/man-with-ball_26f9-fe0f-200d-2642-fe0f.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e\u003cimg src=\"https://emojipedia-us.s3.dualstack.us-west-1.amazonaws.com/thumbs/120/google/223/octopus_1f419.png\" class=\"img-responsive\" width=\"18\" style=\"width:100% !important;max-width: 18px;\" alt=\"\"\u003e is.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003ePayPal, which pulled out of Facebook’s Libra cryptocurrency project, is a partner. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eFacebook’s assured us that payment data is encrypted, private, and monitored for fraud. Users can add a PIN or biometric controls (like face unlock) for extra security. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, Complaints can be directed to the antitrust division at the DOJ. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTaking on TikTok\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eYesterday, Instagram started \u003ca href=\"https://variety.com/2019/digital/news/instagram-reels-brazil-1203401673/?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003etesting\u003c/a\u003e a new feature in Brazil called “Reels” that spices up videos with music and fancy editing tools. Sound familiar?\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eYes, but there's a big difference\u003c/strong\u003e. TikTok's a standalone app, whereas Instagram is integrating Reels into its existing app. Users can share Reels through stories or messages. They can also see some trending videos in the \"Explore\" section. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWorking in Insta's favor are 1) a prebaked audience of 1+ billion monthly users and 2) the U.S. \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/emerging-tech/stories/2019/11/04/us-launches-national-security-probe-bytedance?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003einvestigating\u003c/a\u003e TikTok's parent company for national security reasons. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003ch2 style=\"font-family:Helvetica, Arial, sans-serif;font-size:19px;font-weight:700;color:#000;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;margin-right:0;margin-left:0\"\u003eTossing out likes\u003c/h2\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eWhen even Kim Kardashian West \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/06/top-takeaways-dealbook-conference?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epipes in\u003c/a\u003e to say likes are bad for mental health, platforms have to (at least pretend to) do something. After months of tests abroad, Instagram's removing likes for some U.S. users. They can still like posts, but metrics won't be public-facing. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eNot everyone's on board. \u003c/strong\u003eSome critics have \u003ca href=\"https://www.cnn.com/2019/11/11/tech/instagram-likes-going-away/index.html?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003epointed\u003c/a\u003e out that comments, bullying, and overly staged content are Instagram's real problems.\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003c!-- SOCIAL LINKS --\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding-top: 12px;\"\u003e\n\u003ca href=\"https://www.facebook.com/sharer/sharer.php?u=https%3A%2F%2Fwww.morningbrew.com%2Fdaily%2Fstories%2F2019%2F11%2F12%2Finstagram-testing-reels-tiktoklike-new-feature\" target=\"_blank\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"text-decoration: none;\" class=\"\"\u003e\n\u003cimg alt=\"\" style=\"display: inline-block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" height=503 src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/YrTRjKUOxidDP78nfY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003c!--[if !mso]\u003e--\u003e\u003c!-- --\u003e\n\u003cimg class=\"story-header-image\" alt=\"Disney's old title sequence animation \" style=\"display: block; width: 100%; max-width: 670px;\" width=\"670\" src=\"https://media.giphy.com/media/YrTRjKUOxidDP78nfY/giphy.gif\"\u003e\n\u003c!--\u003c![endif]--\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px;padding-left:10px;margin-top:5px;margin-bottom:0px;line-height:14px;\"\u003e\n\u003csmall\u003e\u003cem\u003eGiphy\u003c/em\u003e\u003c/small\u003e\n\u003c/p\u003e\n\u003ctable width=\"100%\" cellpadding=\"0\" cellspacing=\"0\" border=\"0\" style=\"border-collapse: collapse;\"\u003e\n\u003ctr\u003e\n\u003ctd style=\"padding:15px\"\u003e\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eNearly 100 years ago, The Walt Disney Company was a startup founded by two brothers who thought Mortimer Mouse was a good name for a character. Today, it’s a $250 billion entertainment colossus.\u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eBut in many ways, yesterday’s \u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/11/disney-finally?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003elaunch of Disney+\u003c/a\u003e marks the start of Disney’s next century. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cul style=\"margin-top:0;padding-left:30px\"\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eOver the last two decades, it’s built a huge ecosystem of original content, including Disney classics plus world-class IP from Pixar, Marvel, Star Wars, and Nat Geo. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003cli style=\"line-height:22px;margin-bottom:10px\"\u003e\u003cspan\u003eWith Disney+, the company’s going where the cord-cutting customers are. Disney created a technology platform for direct-to-consumer distribution, standing up an offering to compete with Netflix, Apple TV+, and Amazon Prime Video. \u003c/span\u003e\u003c/li\u003e\r\n\u003c/ul\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003eThe first Disney century wasn’t always easy. There were worker strikes, slumps in creativity, and a world war. Walt’s vision, and especially his successors’, often took trial and error. Just yesterday, the Disney+ rollout was \u003ca href=\"https://www.reuters.com/article/us-walt-disney-streaming-outages/disney-launch-marred-by-glitches-as-demand-overwhelms-idUSKBN1XM1VP?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eplagued\u003c/a\u003e by glitches. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003cstrong style=\"color:#000\"\u003eSo how’d Disney get here? \u003c/strong\u003e\u003ca href=\"https://www.morningbrew.com/daily/stories/2019/11/12/4-minute-history-disney?utm_source=morning_brew\" target=\"_blank\" class=\"link\" rel=\"noopener\" style=\"border-bottom:2px solid #1c7ff2;text-decoration:none;color:#333\"\u003eCheck out our four-minute history\u003c/a\u003e. \u003c/p\u003e\r\n\u003cp style=\"line-height:22px;margin-top:0;margin-bottom:15px\"\u003e\u003csup class=\"sub-text\"\u003e\u003cem\u003eThis is the second part in our series on the streaming wars.
